goal.ch:
(a) Problem Solving: Develop proficiency in using computational techniques to solve mathematical problems involving linear equations, eigenvalue problems, and least-squares problems.
(b) Algorithm Understanding: Develop a solid understanding of the algorithms used in numerical linear algebra, including their theoretical foundations and prac- tical implementations.
(c) Conditioning: Explore the concept of conditioning in numerical problems, un- derstanding how it affects the stability and accuracy of numerical algorithms.
(d) Programming Skills: Enhance programming skills and become proficient in using relevant computer scientific packages, such as Matlab, to implement nu- merical algorithms and solve practical problems.
(e) Applications: Explore real-world applications of numerical linear algebra, demon- strating how these techniques are used in fields like engineering, physics, finance, and data science.
goal.en:
(a) Problem Solving: Develop proficiency in using computational techniques to solve mathematical problems involving linear equations, eigenvalue problems, and least-squares problems.

(d) Programming Skills: Enhance programming skills and become proficient in using relevant computer scientific packages, such as Matlab, to implement nu- merical algorithms and solve practical problems.
(e) Applications: Explore real-world applications of numerical linear algebra, demon- strating how these techniques are used in fields like engineering, physics, finance, and data science.

outline.ch:
• A review of basic linear algebra (from §1, §2, and §6)
• Solving linear systems of equations (§11, §13, §7, and §20)
• Solving eigenvalue problems (§18, §6, and §14)
• Solving least-squares problems (§16 and §15)

textbook.ch:
Textbook: Numerical Linear Algebra with Applications: Using MATLAB, W. Ford, Academic Press. Electronic version of the book is available in NCU library. The selected lecture note slides will be provided.

References:
• Numerical Mathematics and Computing, 7th edition, W. Cheney, D. Kincaid,
Brooks/Cole, CEBGAGE Learning.
• Numerical Computing with MATLAB, Moler, SIAM, 2004. Individual chapters and Matlab codes can be downloaded at http://www.mathworks.com/moler/
• Scientific Computing: An Introductory Survey, McGraw-Hill, 2nd edition, 2002. The lecture notes based on this book can be downloaded at http://heath.cs.illinois.edu/scicomp/
